text: Love this vacuum and have had it over a year now and it still runs great.  It's easy to empty and clean out the hair and other things that get caught up in it.  Will never sweep again!

Great for pet hair!  My retractable cord was defective when received so I had to take it apart to try to get the cord to actually retract.  It’s still very finicky and feels like I’m going to break the plastic lever for as hard as I have to push it to get the cord to retract.  Wish this had a better handle for carrying up/down the stairs.

I purchased this vacuum due to the great price and reviews, but am not pleased.  I have hardwood floors and a cat, and when I clean around the cat's litter, it shoots the litter all over the room making me do even more work in the end.  I would have to remove the detachable nozzle and manually clean up the cat litter.  Also, the vacuum is very powerful and shredded some wires that were too close to me while cleaning - something that has never been a problem before.  In addition, this vacuum is extremely loud - to the point where it makes my ears ring.  The whole neighborhood knew I had gotten a new vacuum. My boyfriend has had enough of the noise and we are shopping for a new one.
Good thing i only needed this because of the attachment because it would pick up anything on the floor not happy with this at all

First of all I'm a Dyson fanatic....I have a total of three (one on each floor).  When we bought our cabin I couldn't stand to give one up and felt too cheap to buy another one (they are pricey) for carpet I'm on five or six times a year so I bought this.  At first I was thrilled.  It was wonderful.  After using it a few times however it has completely lost suction.  Keep in mind this is being used in a second home with no kids, pets or real dirt.  I would doubt that it's on except that it's noisy and takes off without me.  I have bought new filters and looked for blockages but nothing has worked.  Also the "dirt container" is sometimes hard to remove and put back.  Feels like it's catching on something.  What a waste of money.  Even in my college days I've never had a worse vacuum.  I highly recommend the Dyson instead or even the $50 Dirt Devil I gave my niece as a wedding present- it cleans circles around this thing.  To me "Hoover" spells "DISAPPOINMENT"!
purchase this to replace my dyson animal  old version.  review where correct.  but it does not work as good as dyson.  will be working on getting my dyson fixed after he new year.
It does not pick up all hair. The hair also gets caught in the brush every time. It’s not what I read by any means, but does an ok job.

I bought this lightweight model for the price, but I was pleasantly surprised by how much gunk it got up. I really thought my 10 year old Eureka wasn’t that bad, replaced it because it was so heavy. Turns out, wasn’t working at all. I like everything about this little Dirt Devil except it doesn’t stand up on its own, but that’s a minor quibble.
Great little vacuum cleaner, so glad I bought it.

Got this exact model from Walmart for just under $130 + tax. Assembly was easy, although the pictures on the guide sheet are not easy to follow. One plastic tab snapped off the hose bracket when I pressed it in place. I decided not to bother taking it back.

As a cleaner, it is literally amazing. I watched my carpets go from grimy gray to blue, and dog hair and dust particles removed from various nooks and crannies with the tools.

BUT... once the canister is full it is literally a nightmare to clean. Pulling it out results in a shower of grime. And emptying it out required me to literally bend up a metal coat hanger and spend a good 15 minutes pulling and digging matted hair out of the innards, where it gets trapped between various internal projections. Shaking, pounding and trying to pull different parts apart did nothing. Now maybe this won't be a problem if pet hair is not a major ingredient on your floor but I see other complaints here about the canister design. And the problem is far worse if you overfill the canister, so you have to track the level like a hawk. Who needs that?

I'd give this unit 5 stars other than the canister problem. Eureka needs to redesign the canister and make a built-in plunger you can simply depress to push the dirt out -- voila! I'd pay an extra 20 bucks for that, easily. As it is, I'm debating going back and trying to get a refund.

I purchased this vacuum after reading (mostly) good reviews here. The build quality is decent as well as performance. The one touch height/surface control is a back saver. Warranty is excellent.
However, there is a flaw with the the way you're supposed to empty the dirt. The latch is pretty flimsy and it is very messy to empty the container. It seems that all lint, dust and hair sticks to the middle plastic part which needs to be taken out every time. If you think you can empty it simply by pushing a button (as shown in videos), forget about it.

Had this vacuum for three months. It's supposed to be a commercial vacuum. It started making a very loud noise and began smoking, then lost it's suction. I still haven't heard from anyone about a replacement or refund. I'll buy something else.
Not that great. I've had worse. Not very versatile. I like that it's cordless, otherwise there are better options at this tier.

Decent vacuum, but not the one to buy if you have hardwood floors. This model doesn't have the option to turn the brushroll off, so when vacuuming wood floors I think it throws more dirt/sand back at your feet than it sucks up. For carpet it is working great. Suction power is wonderful. It tends to suck up half an area rug before I get a chance to stop it. The rewinding cord is a great feature. No more rolling up cords. But it can rewind at some speed, so watch you shins as the end comes by.

What I love about it... it's a $20 vacuum.
What I hate about it... it's a $20 vacuum.
I got $20 out of it... if you honestly are wanting a high performing vacuum, then you have to pay for it! But if you need a cheap vacuum to (in my case) float you a month or 2 until your shark comes in, then this is perfect! Would also be good for a dorm or very small apartment with no pets or kids.

It's really amazing the amount of dust picked up by this vacuum. I like that it's a HEPA-filtered vacuum too, which is nice because I can still breathe after vacuuming (unlike my cheapo old vacuum which caused me to need my inhaler). I live in a carpeted apartment with two VERY FURRY kitty cats. If I let a week pass before vacuuming, I have to empty the canister twice in my 1,200 sq foot apartment! The vacuum really does work as advertised... it does not loose its suction and really picks up the dust and cat hair.
I bought the Animal (aka purple), because it was on sale. The difference between the three versions (yellow, red, and purple) is the attachments they come with. The yellow comes with none, the red comes with the floor attachment, and the purple comes with the floor and "animal" attachment. I strongly recommend that you just purchase the yellow model, since I haven't found much need for the attachments. I haven't used the floor attachment yet, but the animal one is a bit of a pain (but I could be using it wrong). The attachment kinda swivels when I'm trying to use it on my furniture to remove the cat hair. I find that rubbing a damp kitchen glove works better than the animal attachment at removing cat hair.
The hose really extends far, but I find that the vacuum still moves around when I use the hose. Maybe my hose isn't as worn in yet, or maybe there are brakes on the vacuum I haven't found.
One other negative about this vacuum is the canister. There's a nifty trigger to remove the canister, and another nifty trigger to drop the bottom of the canister for emptying dust. However, sometimes the bottom of the canister doesn't close all the way so I have to hold onto it until I get can get it over a trash can or over the vacuum. Maybe there's dust in the cracks to cause the problem, but that's just a minor annoyance.
That said, I really do love this vacuum. Having it has greatly improved my quality of life and it's pretty to boot!

have been going back and forth with Shark about design flaws,which they admit to, but refuse to do anything about. One flaw is that the unit easily tips backward while using the the suction hose attachments.
Their fix is return it to Amazon, my response to them was that Amazon did not design the unit.
Euro Pro had a wonderful response to my emails and phone calls, "thanks to feedback from people like me, future customers will enjoy an improved product". Sorry that does not help me in the here and now.

So I've owned a Dyson corded vacuum for 15 years and love it, but wrapping the cord is a chore.  I didn't have high expectations for this cordless vacuum, I just wanted it for the car and for small - quick cleanups.  OMG, I LOVE this machine.  It works so well, it has so much suction.  I'm able to vacuum my whole house and still have battery life.  I highly recommend this vacuum to everyone.

Purchased for use on thick carpet.  It works great.  My big negative and the reason for no 5 stars was that it doesn't have hand tools.  I didn't realize how much I used those little tools until I no longer had them!  I also don't think it works that well on bare floors.

This product was indeed intuitive. I love how easily the parts separate and reconnect. It fits under most furniture and the roller ball allows the vacuum to move easily around fixed objects. It is very light and easy to carry up stairs. So far the suction has been very good.

I have worn out many vacs doing janitorial -  so I like the Bissell brand for the filter design and height adjustments.  It worked great at first - now I have to go slow or it doesn't do the job.  It has a washable foam filter to clean - but still seems to have lost some suction.  I should have just bought one of their full size units.

Great until it dies or the hose disintegrates.  Duck tape on top and bottom of main hose. Tips over if  you use attachments unless you hold it but has great suction. Now I lost suction and the issue is in the motor. With the need for a dozen hoses to keep up with tears, i am tossing it in the trash after just over 2 years.

Love this vaccum. Powerfull with minimal upkeep. It has led headlights that have shown dust in places i wouldnt see without them. The best part is the handle that comes out for extended reach suck stick. Im tall so i use it to get corners on the floor the stairs the ceiling nothings safe from my suck stick.

For the price you can’t really go wrong but the vacuum feels cheap and plastic-y. Even the sound of it is like a yippy dog version of a vacuum. HATE that the power cord needs to be manually put back. The attachment hose constantly comes off the machine and it’s too short to reach anything. Had a similarly priced Hoover reviously which I’m missing right about now even though that one didn’t last too long. It has great suction power though.
It is heavy, doesn't have a light, and hard to push on carpet sometimes (I am an active 30 year old)

The idea of the vacuum is very good. It's nice to be able to have the extra suction power when needed to vacuum hairs from carpets.  The execution however was not so impressive. It would be more convenient to have a vacuum that picks up what is needed automatically, rather than having to push another button.  The materials used feel cheap and the cables fall when pushing the vacuum.  When I initially pushed the button, the roller didn't work and my husband had to adjust it to get it to work. The automatic rewind worked well initially, but then required that I hold the cable to help feed it.  Overall, a good idea, but needs some improvements in material quality and engineering to be a great vacuum.

I bought this for my mother and it was absolutely perfect for her.  It was lightweight, full of power and extended parts help her reach plenty of places!!! Made her happy and feel independent!  Thank you!
I should have researched vacuum more thoroughly because it does not come with an extended crevice tool.  Had I known I wouldn't have purchased it.
I am not able to use it because it came with parts missing. I was refunded thank goodness. Why would anyone sell anything items without all its parts

I have had the vacuum for 6 months. It works great when it is working. After 6 months, the roller stopped working. Called Shark to see what I can do. The bottom part of the vacuum is bad. Come to find out that it isnt under warranty. I was a surprised. specially since the vacuum was only 6 months old.

Had to buy a new bottom part to in order to use my vacuum

I agree with the reviewers who say the vacuum cleaner topples over easily when using the suction hose. However, the problem isn't the unit's light weight, it's the design. The hose is attached to the *top* of the vacuum cleaner, not the bottom. Of course it's going to topple over with the slightest tug on the short hose.

The other annoying design element is the handle -- which doubles as an extension hose. It's not long enough to reach the floor while you're standing, and it's awkward/difficult to use the extension with one hard -- that's required unless you want to drag the vacuum cleaner around your house on its side.

If you're using this vacuum cleaner exclusively for carpeted floors and aren't going to use the hose/attachments, I think you'd be hard pressed to find a better deal. For those who want something more flexible, I'd look elsewhere.
Im happy with my purchase. Cleans floor great. Love how the sucking power comes right back with a fresh bag; Fast shipping.
https://smile.amazon.com/dp/B00C351GBC/ref=cm_cr_ryp_prd_ttl_sol_0  Shark Navigator Stick Vacuum.  This little vacuum works like a charm.

We were in a rush to get a vacuum for the new home, and this one sounder like it would do the trick.
Aside from being one of the most noisy vacuums ever, it does a rather poor job and picking up dirt, fills quickly, a bit messy, and just not a good buy.

Vacuum out of box was easy to assemble. Great when vacuuming bare floor. However.... the one I received had an issue with the height adjustment. It would not raise up to be able to use the vacuum on carpet, couldn't even push the vacuum it was that bad. Contacted Bissell and went through an on-line troubleshoot chat - big mistake! Who ever it was that was responding was not knowledgeable at all, the whole experience was a total waste of time. Put vacuum back in box and returned it :(. Sorry, hard to assign stars when I couldn't completely use it. Seemed to manuver well on bare floor, not as lightweight as a stick vacuum, suction seemed good on bare floor, I did find the brush area bit too wide for some spots and a little tough to get under furniture.
Liked it so much I purchased one for my daughter as a gift. She loves it. The handle when used to suction furniture, stairs is alittle heavy for me but I’m 60. Well made I use for floors and carpet

I had it for 1.5 years before the cheap, thin plastic button on the canister broke.  It's what holds it on tight to make it function correctly, so this breaks the entire vacuum.  It performed very well up until then.

Works great until all the pieces break like the power button and the suction hose…This thing maybe worked well for three months and then just became one problem after another. And good luck getting a hold of Hoover and buy parts. I sure wish I would’ve bought a warranty through Amazon  for this dud. So frustrating.

the worse vacuum ever owned and i loved Bissell :(  it doesnt go over the house carpets well low pile cheap carpet get stuck making it hard to push and doesnt go over rugs just like the carpet. i hate that i have to take the hose out from the base of the vacuum in order to use the hand tools then have to struggle to put it back to the vacuum again and i cant turn off the brush while using the hand tools thats a problem only because the thing vibrates so much it makes the loudest noise its so incredibly annoying . its so bad i went back to my old vacuum actually bought the stuff to make it work again. i was in denial that i really liked it so i threw box away very soon wish i could of returned it but now my husband puts up with it if i have the other one to help me out with the vacuuming . I can see why someone might like it. its light and if your house isnt needing to be hand tooled every day then its probably a good vacuum for you. you possibly could look past the vibrating also. but not me i just cant stand it i need to be able to vacuum and switch to the tools without compromising going back to floor immediately. dont need to be fooling around with shoving a hose back in place. im not even sure if im making it clear about how you use the hose but its nothing like ive ever dealt with and im trying to warn people. Maybe i just didnt understand what i was getting but any ways hope it help you for what i just said. its a no go. update months later i still cant stand this vacuum .
I like the vacuum it works well but there is no handle on top when you are using the wand so I keep pulling off the attachments.

No explanation as to how to operate the vacuum and no guarantee were in packing box....I am not happy..I tried to call yesterday and didn’t get a person to talk too.  This was a birthday gift to me and I just opened it.

It is very effective for carpets.
It has no effect on the floor or marble floor.
The flexibility is not good, the position of the hose is very inconvenient, the appearance is good, but it is not practical enough, the price is too expensive, and the utility is not consistent.
The vacuum was good until it wasn’t. Best 3 1/2 months I ever had out of a vacuum, I just wish it would have lasted longer.
Only  two cheap attachments,  they don't stay on hose or storage positions.  Old attachments  from old Shark won't fit this one.

I am the  type of girl  that cleaning is one of my hobby!!! and I need a gadget that make my job more easier and easy to manage!! I like this vacuum because its not heavy and multitasking I could use it on the floor, carpet and the very corner of the house

I've heard it all before about Dysons being great and above and beyond so I went with this one.  I actually was going to get the ANIMAL but decided to go to Bed Bath & Beyond to test it out before ordering on here and...It didn't even get all the grit in the carpet.  I looked at the salesguy and scoffed and decided that the yellow Ball performed better even though it felt awkward. This is hardly amazing and quite loud.  When used on hardwood it makes an even more anmnoying sound.  Not worth the monkey at all!  below par, and very bulky.  Shop around--there's better for less money out ther.
It is nice and small you can move it around easily. Break easily and it is very difficult to get help from the third party company.

I was so excited to receive a new vacuum as I have a dog that sheds long white hair. Upon arrival it was missing pieces and when I went to use it it was extremely hard to push. I had to use actual physical strength just to push the vacuum. Unfortunately I purchased another one from Amazon that was not much better

Bought this 5 months ago. I have primarily hard wood floors. I use this for rugs and bedrooms once a week. Today it broke belt due to the brush locking up and no longer free spinning. Out of hundreds of reviews this is my first one star review.

Today was the first time I tried to use my brand new Shark Rotator XL and found it extremely heavy to move as it is not self propelling and although it's supposed to be only 15 lbs, feels like 50. In fact, it wound up being a two person job. Someone stronger had to move it around, while someone shorter had the use the "xl" wand to get beneath the furniture. If it's supposed to be XL, they should supply a much longer wand so that the user doesn't have to bend so far to get beneath the furniture. It was an exhausting and back breaking job. The suction seemed sufficient so if all you need is a vacuum for a few area rugs, it's ok, but not for wall to wall carpeting in several rooms. It's just too much work. Unfortunately, this will have to be returned. If someone out there has found a good suction,self propelling, automatic cord rewind, easy to empty, vacuum, I'd like to know which one it is.
I need a new one.  broke again after a few months It will not vacuum up I sent an email to the manufacure still nothing.

Hoover WindTunnel2 June 2021- January 2022. Bought to use in a small office area in our building, no different than a living room and bedroom. It was dedicated to one area. Did great the first month, then started having issues and finally died in January of 2022. Order another early February, belt burn up, and started smoking in July 2022. Now to find another one.

Just got it today. Easy to put together, great suction however the wheels are not the best on carpet and often times take a little convincing to get going. I also personally hate the febreze filter they gave us. The filter gave me a headache so I switched it to the normal one. All and all it’s okay for the price and will hopefully last a little bit till we can get a better one.

I have had other Dirt Devil vaccuums, but this one surpasses all of them. The suction is great and the best thing is how the handle can be used for a longer reach when using just the hose. Cleans Very Well!!
Awesome vacuum. Dysons are the best. I've tried so many other kinds of vacuums and they don't compare. This one works great and is easy to use.
Nice and light, pretty good suction for such a small and inexpensive unit.  Took a while to assemble, the instruction manual appeared to be translated from Chinese.

I got it for half price (special offer for a week), it works great. I am not too excited about about cord rewind part though, It was a replacement for my church. I would rather have a longer cord, and not half to worry that someone will pull it out too far and break the rewind mechanism.
Cheap, solid, easy to clean, good suction.  I would upgrade to the T-Series above this one with the light.  (Blue).  It's just a bit nicer and worth the upgrade.  I buy one of these every year.

This is the 3rd hoover product that I have purchased and I can honestly say that i don't know if they are any better or worse that any other. I do know that they have worked very well for me. The last one I purchased last October completely quit yesterday. I called hoover service and was told that I would have to take it to a service center. I called the service center and was told that by the time the paper work is done and Hoover sends the parts would be up to 2 weeks. I have 2 puppies and didn't buy a carpet cleaner to be without it for 2 weeks.
Ive only had this product a year and 7 months and it has already stopped working! used it today and it was smoking at the bar...

Why does t it shut off when it’s locked in the upright position???? I’ve never seen a vacuum that didn’t... this one the main roller brush just keeps spinning... why??? They really need to fix that it’s going to burn up my flooring while I’m using the tools.

Outside of that... it’s great. Easy to maneuver. Picks up dog hair like a boss. Overall great vacuum... expect it won’t stop spinning when your using the tools... stupid design.

I own the Hoover Platinum and LOVE it. I decided to use this to keep in our basement where 2 of the 3 dogs sometimes stay. While I loved to see it work and I love that it has a bag. It didn't do a great job of picking up the little white hairs from our American Bulldog, it picked up the Rottweiler & Australian Shepherd hairs good enough, but after several passes in the same spot, I could still see his thick, short, white hairs. I do want to say that when I was using this, it had a decent smell unlike my Hoover after going through my basement (because of the dogs)
awesome  works like a very expensive vacuum. The power is great  the ease of taking off the canister to dump and the attachments are all great

This WAS a great vacuum... Unfortunately for me it had fallen one to many times because of the unstableness of the unit which I knew when I bought it. I just thought I would be extra careful with it. And I was, but it had still fallen over a couple times. I just moved and it fell over while moving it to the room with all the boxes. The little latch spring that holds the wand/attachment hose to the rest of the vacuum came out and now I can't find it. So now I have it duct taped together, hoping I can get the piece from the company so I can fix it. I wish they would have made that a little stronger anyway.

I bought this vacuum a little over two years ago directly from Dyson and have been meaning to write a review ever since. Better late than never!

For reference, I have concrete floors, wooden floors, and lots of rugs. I use my vacuum for all of the above to pick up dirt and pet hair. I have two cats and two large dogs (a Great Dane and a large mutt) weighing in at a total of 260lbs.

Pros:
This is fantastic for normal vacuuming on flat surfaces. I’m always amazed at the amount of dirt and animal hair it picks up.

I really like that this is bag less although I have to empty it several times when using.

Cons:
The ball and wheels are large so it is hard to get under furniture like coaches and beds.

It is a BIG pain to use the wand. And I use the wand A LOT. You are constantly fighting with it and end up pulling the whole vacuum, having the vacuum tip over, and/or having the hose kink up. The wand hose always wants to retract back into the vacuum and really pulls the whole vacuum around with you. You have to try to put the vacuum against something so it won’t tip over and have the hose at the right angle so you get proper suction. Using this would be especially challenging for anyone older because it takes some strength to pull the wand and use it.

I use my Dyson to vacuum furniture like coaches and dog beds. I think any pet owners do this as well. Previously, I’ve had canister vacuums that worked well, I bought this prior to Dyson having these. Now, I use the wand plus the Tangle-free Turbine tool. It isn’t very effective. The tool is really small so you can’t cover a lot of surface area plus you are always fighting with the wand wanting to retract back into the vacuum. The suction isn’t very great either.

In the canister itself, pet hair and dust gets stuck up inside the top of the canister on either side of the top filter. Not a huge deal but it is a pain and nasty to try to get out.

Overall, if I ever get another Dyson, I will try out a canister model because I think it would fit my needs better. But I would also investigate other brands that may be better for getting hard to reach surfaces as well as upholstery. For the price and the hype of Dysons, I’m disappointed in this vacuum. I would give it 2.5 stars if I could.

This is the 3rd shark I've owned. All have been refurbished. The previous two I got about 4 years out of them before replacing. This one lasted a year and a half. Also, the first of this one I had to return because it was super noisy. Got the replacement and it was fine. But a year and a half later I had to get a new vacuum because the hose broke at the handle and the carpet roller function stopped working regularly.

I thought when I read the reviews of this one I'd be alright getting it for my small apartment. But after using it a few times it got less and less effective until it just quit working in a few months.

Would have given this vacuum 5 stars had the on/off switch been on the handle instead of having to reach half way down the unit to reach it. It does a fine job of sucking dirt off both carpets and bare floors. It is very easy to clean. Definitely give it a good recommendation.

Cleans dust well, but terribly cleans cat's fur from a carpet. Almost all fur pieces remain on a carpet after cleaning.
It is critical for me as a cat owner. Returning it.

Have had it for a week, got it when my Dyson Animal Ball V2 needed repair again.  This vacuum is a beast, much more suction than the Dyson, and just works better.  The ability to adjust carpet size is awesome.  Trying to do a high pile carpet with the Dyson was work, hard work and it just didn't do a good job -- not so with the Kenmore - i can maneuver the vacuum and it gets the dirt and pet hair up.  The attachment works great, it gets the dog hair off my couches with one pass - wherewith the Dyson it took several passes and a bit of work.  The hose could be longer for the attachments, but nothing i can't live with given how good of a job it does. Very please with the Kenmore overall.
We have dogs so we vacuum every day.  Ive taken the vacuum apart and cleaned it but it still smells bad. When we vacuum it puts dirt and dust right back in the air.

For the price, I was pleasantly surprised to see how well this did the job! It pulled up so much cat hair with the first use. It's very simple to use, the charger is simple to use, and I even really enjoyed the detachable handheld! Might bring it into my car for a quick clean up!

I love this new vacuum. It's replacing the WindTunnel I bought 7 years ago. This one really sucks up pet hair and leaves my floors and carpet very clean. With 3 shedding dogs, I'm using the vacuum daily. It's very light and easy to carry up and down stairs. Also great for vacuuming upholstery and staircases.. The only "complaint" is the hose is very short so you can't be too far away from what you're vacuuming. The crevice tool is really helpful for getting into tight spaces. Great price for this vacuum.

"You purchased this item on August 17, 2015"  6 months later I smell burning and it's smoking while using it.  I'm worried it will catch fire.  After letting it cool so I don't burn my fingers, and taking it apart, I find the plastic beater bar where the belt slides around it melted and warped and reshaped and remolded in one area around the belt.  It's a wonder this did not start a fire in my home.  I'm on hold with Bissell to find out their warranty but have been on hold for over 7 minutes now.  Not happy with this purchase and can't say I would recommend it to anyone.  I'll try to upload a picture and give an update once I have dealt with their customer service and their handling of the situation.
Great vacuum. Bought this to have a second Shark Navigator for the house. This one has a shorter power cord than first one unfortunately.  Needs another 24 inches to the cord to make it 5 stars.
Works great on my area rugs, but just like most vacuum cleaners hair gets tangled in the roller but not very hard to remove!

Very good vacum, picks up more then my last one. As others have said it is VERY loud. I can't vacuum while my night shift worker tries to sleep during days...too loud. BUT I kept it as it was so good. The attachments work great as well..wish the stretchy cord for attachments was longer, but still worth it.

Had one of these vacuums (green version) for 3-4 years and it was my favorite vacuum. Eventually the motor stopped working properly (which is okay for the cost and it's to be expected after that much use), so then I bought this one to replace it. It works just fine, but the retractable cord doesn't work as well as my old one. Maybe I pulled it out too far on my first use, but it's still a good vacuum nonetheless.

I upgraded my vacuum to the shark after reading reviews and receiving recommendations from friends.  I am in love with this thing.  It was pretty simple to put together and works amazing.  I had vacuumed with my old vacuum a couple days prior and when I used this it shocked me to see how much dirt and pet hair it sucked up that my old vacuum had left behind.  So far, I have not seen any cons with this vacuum.

This should have been Light weight, light so I can see what I'm vacuuming, the hand held wand does not have great suction, it's super hard to push back and fourth. This Vacuum is just to heavy for women. Especially if your older. I wish I can rate lower. Poor design. It's been 3 months and I hope I can still refund this and get a hoover like I should have. I wanted something that is light and easy to lift and push. It vacuum great, but the Cons out weighs the Pros.

I wanted to love this vacuum.  It is definitely the most powerful vacuum I've ever used and cleans floors superbly.  Also, for a heavy machine, it maneuvers easily.  It also fits underneath furniture better than I anticipated.  Now the but... The handle plugs into the base and is supposed to lock in place via a switch.  However, the locking mechanism on my vacuum was flawed and I could never get the handle to lock securely.  Each time I used the vacuum, the handle would come unplugged at least once - most often 2 or 3 times.  Very frustrating - especially for a vacuum at this price point. Sadly, I'm returning the vacuum for this reason.

Would love to review this vacuum but it arrived broken.
Bought same one at big box store for $10 less. Easy assembly w only 2 screws. Light easy maneuver. Picks up w no issues.
If you're hard on vacuums this is not the one for you. Its has filters YOU MUST CLEAN BEFORE/After use to avoid loss of suction. Not good for wood/tile as most are not designed for that.
For the $ it does the job.
Save your money and move on. This vacuum just blows crap out and sucks up next to nothing. Very very poor quality.

I liked that the parts are sturdy, easy to use and has a lot of power. It feels heavy and large and is difficult in tight spaces. It cleans my hardwood floors better than my shark rotator which I like. This is my third shark so I like the product overall.

Most of the reviews were based on the Bordeaux color so I wanted to include one on the blue. This vacuum is awesome!  This is like my third shark. I have. Little battery operated that is significantly lighter so it was hard to put 5 stars, but in comparison to the vacuum my mother used to have its a lot lighter. It’s all relative.

This vacuum is a piece of junk!  We purchased it based on the high ratings; however, it started breaking within just a few months.  A year later, most of the accessory pieces are broken, the clip for the cord is gone, and it will no longer stay upright on its own.  The Dyson that we bought 10 years ago is still working fine, and still has all of its parts working.  It looks like Hoover is no longer the quality that it used to be.

I love the automatic cord retractor, and for a fairly low cost vacuum, it does the job. I just wish all vacuums were built in a way that the handle would go all the way down so you can get the vacuum under coffee tables, beds, etc.

The vacuum fell over after my wife tripped on the cord and it broke the handle clear in half, and off course I can't return it, because it's been over a month. It has good suction and maneuverability but it's very lightweight and flimsy. It didn't last.

I’ve had this vacuum for about 5 1/2 years, and since it’s still in production, I figured I’d put in my 2 cents. It still works great after all that time, and I plan on using it until it ultimately dies. I rarely use any of the attachments aside from the extended hose, but for regular carpet vacuuming it’s done it’s job. We have 2 cats, so you can imagine the amount of fur we have to clean up on a regular basis. The canister can hold quite a bit of debris too and it’s super easy to dispose of in an upright trash can. We haven’t had to replace any of the filters, but we clean them a few times a year. If you have long hair, it does collect quickly along the roller brush, but it’s easy to pull off of there to clean every few uses. I’ve sucked up some stuff accidentally through the hose attachment too that shouldn’t go through there (a bottle cap, and a toy mouse for starters), and they never compromised anything inside the vacuum. They’ll just make a loud clunking sound so you know something’s in there that shouldn’t be, and it can easily be disposed of by emptying the canister.

My only complaint is that obviously it’s bulky, but easy to navigate. As far as sound, it probably falls somewhere in the middle compared to other vacuums.

You're wrestling with this just to maneuver to vacuum a room.  May tilt, but does not do corners for another lane on the carpet.  Likes straight forward not coming back.  Does not pick up litter well.  Does not like hair.  You get the extra blessing of allergens on your hands sticking it into the compartment that doesn't empty (hair stays up in the chamber).

I bought this vacuum after reading the reviews on Amazon and Consumer Reports. After using the vacuum I am surprised how many people compared it to a Dyson. My previous vacuum was a Dyson and although it was more expensive it was also a much better vacuum! In reality if I did not have to mail back such a large piece of equipment I would return this item. The suction is okay especially on carpets but the performance on floors is poor. The equipment is cheap. The wand function is a joke.
I appreciate the speedy delivery from Amazon. I will not purchase another Hoover vacuum again.

Cleans very well. It moves very easily, and grabbing the attachments is easy. Transitioning the height for carpet vs. hardwood is a little clunky with the dial, but small gripe for an overall terrific cleaning experience.

Purchased this item a little over two years ago. Suddenly stopped working after about being used 6 or 7 times. Took it to a local vacuum repair center and was told that it was either the switch or the motor. Then was also told that Hoover sees to it that parts like that are NOT available in the U.S. Went online to some of the supply houses and found out he was right, Those types of parts are not available. Contacted Hoover and was told to send in a copy of the original receipt, and I would hear back from them in 2-3 business days. It's now been 10 business days and I have sent 5-6 email requests for information, and nothing from them. I guess they are all out to lunch. Even the Chat produced no results. My next step is just to throw it out. I thought they were a reputable company. I have a Hoover Vac., when it goes I won't touch any of their products again.

When I first received my Hoover WIndtunnel Air Bagless Upright, I was very pleased.  It is very lightwight and has very ;powerful suction.  The other day I decided to use the extension hose to vacuum some stairs.  After attaching the extension hose, I pulled it out about 4 feet and both ends pulled away from the hose.  Now, I do not have an extension hose.  I am very disappointed that this happened and wonder what I  can do to get another hose.

Like most, I was reluctant to buy this vacuum due to the Shark brand and how heavily they're pushed on infomercials. But after using the vac there are a lot of things I like about it. However, all the good things that I like are waging a battle in my brain with how damn ugly and cheap this thing looks. The pictures don't translate how bad the shiny red and silver chrome "plating" is. Oh well, at least it performs.

Like a few others, I bought the Dyson DC41 to compare. I bought the Dyson the same day, opened it up and literally used it right next to the Shark. I went around the entire house and did parallel sweeps of all the large areas to get equal samples. I spent the same amount of time and went the same amount of distance with each. I then emptied each bin onto separate paper towels to see which vac picked up the most. Not horribly scientific but it worked. The most shocking thing was how dirty our carpet was. The second most shocking thing was that there was big difference in the piles from each vac. I really, really wanted the Dyson to win. Like I said the Shark is so damn ugly it deserves to lose. Not only does the Dyson look cooler but I was believing the hype about how much engineering went into their vacs. Lots of expensive engineering should win, right? But unfortunately the Shark picked up at least twice as much fuzz and dirt as the Dyson. This is our first bagless vac so just seeing proof that you're pulling stuff out of the carpet that you would ordinarily wouldn't see is kind of satisfying in itself (even though I don't know how anyone can call bagless vacs more hygienic since there's probably a dust storm when you drop your load in the trash)

Our old vac is a Hoover Windtunnel bought thanks to CR's advice. The cord was short and it's very loud. I think it may have vacuumed well but since it's bagged you don't really get the same satisfying feedback and assume it's not picking up much. Plus it was starting to stink. The Hoover would also shoot nuggets all over the place when vacuuming the wood floors since you couldn't turn off the brushroll/bar. This is another thing I tested with both the Dyson and Shark, whether or not they picked up large objects on flat floors. The Shark won again. The Dyson (due its much touted self-adjusting cleaner head) just pushed the bigger stuff around, the Shark got everything. The Shark has a fixed cleaner head height too. The Shark seemed like it did best on the deep pile of our area rug than the relatively short carpet we have but it also passed our hardwood floor test.

Pros:
-Easy to assemble
-It's relatively quiet, not whisper-quiet but much better than our Hoover
-Brushroll is easy to clean, the hair tends to collect in the center - big points for that
-You can turn off the brushroll
-There's window for the brushroll
-There are 2 light to indicate if the brushroll is on or off, one on the button, one by the brushroll
-Picks up big chunks on hardwood floors and doesn't spit them everywhere
-Filters are easily visible, right in your face when you go to empty the bin, so you know when they need to be cleaned
-Reclines and sits up easily, the Dyson is a b*tch when it comes to this
-There's a crude but effective suction adjustment just below the handle
-There's a "cord hook" on the neck so if you don't want the cord dangling down by the attachment
-Easy to empty
-Cord is long enough, even though the Dyson's was longer by a few feet
-The vacuum is easy enough to maneuver and gets under most of the furniture we have
-You can convert it into 3 different vacuums pretty easily
-When you sit the vac upright the brushroll automagically turns off, making things quieter
-The cleaner head is narrow. This seems both good and bad, good because it concentrates the suction area but bad in that it would take longer to vacuum. The Dyson's is 12", the Shark's 9.5"
-Exhausts the (hot) air out the front, the Dyson sends blazing hot air at your legs. I thought the Shark's air was cool or nonexistant until I stuck my hand in front of the HEPA filter where it is on the warm side
-I don't know what the Complete-Seal is they talk about but the vacuum does have 4 filters (more or less): a dust screen, a foam filter, a felt filter that looks like a thin scrub brush and a HEPA filter that looks like a HEPA filter.

Cons:
-It's ugly
-It looks cheap
-The cord release seems loose, there's a screw you can turn but it doesn't seem to help
-The lights are poor, they're too focused and bright, not diffused enough
-Not super light-weight, though this may actually be a Pro since more weight on the front probably helps the vac suck better
-Tools are attached by friction. Dyson's for the most part use a locking system
-The Power Brush seems like a weak link. When you use full suction it almost sounds too powerful. When I looked inside it looked a little sketchy, the brushroll in the Power Brush is vacuum/belt driven and difficult to clean hair out of. It seemed to clean pretty well but the belt is tiny and looks fragile and after one set of stairs there was already gunk built up in the vacuum wheel that drives the belt.

If Shark wanted to have a red shiny metal coating on their vacuum they could have at least went with an anodized finish. It probably would make the vacuum cost $15 more and it would get scratched every time you used it but at least it would look better and solve all my gripes about this thing. So far they get plenty of points for engineering and design but almost as many negative points for material selection. There might be other bagless vacs out there that pull more than the Shark but at least I can return the Dyson now and hope the Shark lasts at least to the end of its warranty.

UPDATE 07/31/2013:

The foam filter has started to rip in 2 places. I believe this is the 2nd filter after the dustbin, so right before the HEPA. It's good that the foam filter has been catching a lot of dust and dirt instead that stuff heading straight for the HEPA. Ideally the dust/dirt would have stayed in the dustbin as designed. The manual recommends to tap-clean the filter between washes which should happen every 3 months. Our carpets were very dirty when we bought the vac so we probably put 4-6 weeks worth of vacuuming into 2 weeks, because of this we hand washed the filters with plain cold water 2 times in between vacuuming. The filter seems to get filled up by the finer, heavier dirt. We've been pretty conservative about emptying the dustbin so it's definitely not an overflow problem. I contacted customer service and they said it's $12.95 +S&H/Tax, so probably $20 for a new filter. It's not covered by the warranty since it's considered normal wear and tear. If the hand washing we did was the cause of the two 1" rips then I guess you can expect the filters to tear after 9 months. So far I haven't found them on Amazon or anywhere else online.

Otherwise we like the vacuum. Surprisingly CR's ratings are right on. Except for maybe the pethair since we don't have pets. One of our family members has long hair and as typical it does get wrapped around the brushroll. It's fairly painless to pull out and it doesn't look like it collects anywhere that it can build up and cause a jam in the brushroll. Another surprising thing is that the vac does a pretty good job getting stuff at the edges but at the same time it doesn't suck up random stuff like the cord or clothes lying around, it's crazy.

We lowered our review from 4 stars down to 3 due to the filter.

Replaces my 10-year old Eureka Boss. Seems to work pretty well, but I find using the hose attachments to be a bit cumbersome (because of the design of the hose and how much you have to pull on it). Some of the attachments seems a bit cheap compared to the Boss. Bagless seems like a good idea until you actually go to empty the canister, it's always messy doing so. Works pretty well on our carpet and floors and it does seem to pick up the cat hair pretty well. I do like that it's lightweight, maneuvers easily, and the cord rewind is a nice feature. It is a good value.
I don't know why I ordered this. I have 4 dogs and 6 kids. This vacuum might work if no one lives in your home ever. Not the case in my house.

1. Like that the company contributes to animal care.
2. DISLIKE that I fell for campaign that they care. This is the poorest suction that I have experienced in vacuum since the 1960s Eureka vacuum.

The suction is very very good!  Picks up animal hair in carpet and hardwood well.  Easy to empty canister.  The downside to this vacuum is that it's heavy and not easily maneuverable around corners.  The hose is rather short and not easy to withdraw to do ceilings, stairs, etc.

Very good suction but dirt cup is on the small size if you have a pet. Heavier than I expected but I found that, on the lowest surface setting, it just about moves itself forward so this more than makes up for the weight while sweeping. Easy to put together and the instructions were actually coherent which is a rarity these days. Thank you Hoover for a frustration-free assembly!

I finally decided to spend the money and buy my Dyson Vacuum Cleaner. I chose the Animal Bagless, since I have 2 small dogs (short hair) that shed all year around. So far, it has only been 3 days since I got the vacuum cleaner, I am just amazed at all the dirt that comes out of my carpet. I had to empty the container 3x when I vacuumed my living room. I just could not believe how much dirt there was hidden in my carpet. My old vacuum cleaner (windtunnel) was not even 1/4 full when I would vacuum the living room.
Putting it together when it arrived - almost 1 week early - was a breeze. I can get very challenged when it comes to reading & following directions, but it was even easy for me to make it work. I had it plugged in within in less then 5 min :-)

All in all, it works very well and I'm very happy with my new Dyson. I also like the fact that it has a 5 YEAR WARRANTY :-)
Broke down really fast (1 month) and pieces very hard to get, now I have almost 1 year still trying to get the pieces to fix

Lasted a little over 7 years, best vacuum I've ever owned. Great suction and easy to use.

Cons: pet hair sticks to the bristles, it's top-heavy, and the power chord is in a poor location.
We are huge Shark fans. However this vacuum has a short cord and less accessories than my older version. The quality seems cheaper as well.

I like the fact that it's light weight and has the swivel head.
I do not like the 'pick up' power - it leaves a lot to be desired. Also it leaves a line of dust behind after you bring it back and push it forward again.
All in all, very disappointed.
Works as it should for about 1 year. Using it and it stopped spinning. Smelled like burning and inside was melted. Making it useless. Get what you pay for here.
Very hard to push on carpet , with no adjustments for carpet height. Suction becomes to powerful that it actually picks up floor mats & moves them around.

Edited review:

Bough in Nov 2020 to use w/newer thick Lifeproof carpet that other vacuums completely failed & choked on, and this was on the list that would keep our warranty.

Not sure why, but it has doubled in price since then. Not sure if Covid supply chain issues or discontinued already or what…?

Only managed to use it 2-3 times after purchase because a good 90% of the time it would not turn on or off when I wanted it to.
This was not only annoying but also a potential safety hazard.

Changed out the handle battery & tried the troubleshooting steps w/no luck. Took it in for warranty repair & the Oreck store guy said they’d had a whole bunch come through for the same reason.

He also said that he had no idea what the fix would be until the parts arrived at the store w/that person’s name on them! Most times they sent a replacement circuit board. Sometimes a new handle assembly. Sometimes they replaced the entire vacuum - but not necessarily w/the same model(!!??).

Clearly this is no longer a high-quality American-made product line - just another Made in China POS w/no quality control, like half the knock-off junk on Amazon these days. Why pay for the Oreck name when it’s really just a crappy overpriced Dirt Devil?

… But I digress.

Repairs took nearly a month, during which time we couldn’t vacuum at all.

Afterwards it seems to work fine - turns on & off as expected, which is basically the bare minimum it ought to do. Suction seems … ok? Works well enough but nothing special. The roller assembly is really no different from our old Dirt Devil so i honestly don’t know what we paid for.

Have only used it maybe twice since getting it back. Seems ok so far. Don’t know how it’ll hold up over time.

Construction seems sturdy enough for a lightweight plastic vacuum, IF the electronics hold up. It’s easy to use & move around, which is nice.

Kinda sucks (heh) that we’ll need a separate machine or manual process for dusting, but with our Lifeproof carpet our vacuum options are extremely limited.

I would recommend this product. It long enough battery power to clean our 850 sq apartment. Very easy to use and not long to charge. The only concern is that I forgot to remove the hairs from the brush which jammed the roller.  I contacted their customer service and explained what's happened. Surprisingly, not only I received the quick response but also they decide to arrange an exchange! I am very happy with their service and hope you can enjoy the project well.
Easy to assemble.  Lightweight easy to maneuver. Seems to work great. Replaced my 23 year old Eureka Bravo.

It works relatively well on rugs, given the low price. I would recommend it if you have carpets, aren't picky about clean floors and do not have a lot of animals, it would work well. But, for some reason, I can not get this thing to clean my floors. I have LVP Flooring and I swear it just kicks up anything I try to vacuum, I have to go over the same spot on the floor at least three times before its passably clean, but even then there is still stuff there. I personally regret buying it, because I never feel like my floors are truly clean and I'm going to have to spend money on a more expensive vacuum anyway.

My husband does the vacuuming. We live in 1000sq ft apt. Had a Dyson for 20yrs. It died, no longer have shedding pets so I thought we would try this. SoHARD to PUSH. My husband said “ don’t be surprised if you come home and find it smashed in the driveway”. He hates it. I should have paid the big bucks. DONT WASTE the MONEY.

*** This is a follow up. My hoover floormates engine died in September, so it only made a several months before it started screaching and smoking. i only used it once a week. I called Hoover and they agreed to cover it under the warranty and they gave me a local service shop and reference number. I called the shop and they will not service Hoovers under the warranty as hoover does not pay them promptly. Unfortunatley I heard this from the 2nd place I called as well. Finally on the third try I was able to find someone who would do it. So reliability is suspect unless I got a lemon and if you do get one that dies under warrantly it may be hard to get it serviced. ***

I love this machine. It has 3 modes: vacuum (no water, brushes do not spin), wash (water, suction, and brushes), and dry (lowers slightly for better suction to "squeegee dry", no brushes). As mentioned do not buy it thinking it will replace your vacuum. The vacuum part is more like a final cleanup of dirt after sweeping or vacuuming with a normal vac, or cleaning if floor just has light dirt or sand on it. It will not suck up large objects like cheerios,tiny pieces of candy, etc. It washes floors like a champ though! The water is filthy when you empty it. I love that I am not pushing around dirty water anymore an no more mop bucket. You will need to make a few passes on dried on things like dried ketchup. The brushes are very soft aand do not "scrub" per se. This is a "good thing" when you are talking about cleaning hardwoods though.

My whole bottom floor is an open floor plan of ceramic tile and hardwood, over 1000 sqr feet. The machine leaves no steaks and floors look so spotless when done. The grout looks much less dirty know as well after a few cleanings. It really gets all the dirt out of the "seams" in the hardwood. Its great for spills too! Make sure you empty and clean it out after it gets full. also, if the suction seems low..take out and put back in the dirty water container...sometimes it looks like it is all the way in and it is not. I have also found turning on and off the vacuum while the handle is upright avoids the missing suction as well.

Pros:
Cleans great, no streaks
good on tile and sealed hardwood
No mop bucket anymore!
Not using dirty water, much more sanitary
Grout gets cleaner than mop becuase it is not leaving dirty water on it to dry
Dries super fast, floor is walkable almost immediately after dry mode
Gets out he dirt and sand trapped in grooves and gaps in hardwood floor
Good for spills

Cons:
Have to use non-solvent cleaner (made by Hoover)..or vinegar- No Pine-sol or it will eventually leak!
Cord is just a few feet short for my large house, so I have to uplug and relcate near the end
No "clip" to hold cord to handle, so I find myself stepping on cord and unplugging sometimes
Brushes are a little too weak and needs a few passes on stuck on stuff
Brushes do not get deep into grout, especially my bathroom which has deep grout lines
you have to rinse the dirty bucket and re-usable filter after each use
Noiser than a mop, but quieter than my normal vacuum

Even though this vacuum has great suction and cleans very well, it is pretty heavy (I have to carry it up and down stairs) and the canister is not easy to clean. I have to actually put my hand inside the canister to get out the remaining dirt/dust that didn't shake out on its own. It's pretty messy and then I've found that I have to vacuum up whatever didn't make its way into the trash. Also, I'm pretty sure the replacement filters are expensive and this vacuum has three.
Broke after 2 months. No power. I emptied filter after every couple of vacs and stuff still got caught in it. Waste of money.

I was concerned about ordering a reconditioned vacuum but for the price (46 dollars at the time) I figured I couldn't go wrong.  I was very happy with the product delivered and it has worked wonderfully for me.  It is very loud I will say that, but it is so much more powerful than the cheaper bagged uprights I always bought brand new. Also, the hose is much better, more flexible than the cheaper uprights. The bagless system is fascinating to me, and cleaning it out is just a snap, no problem at all. All in all I am very happy with my purchase.

bought this one after my Kenmore is 7 years old. And I hesitated since this one is so cheap compared with other brands and models. But after I used for 2 days so far, it's awesome, great value for its price. Light weight, so my wife can operate it and carry it upstairs easily.
Started making a funny sound after 3rd use. It works the same, but sounds bad. It doesn’t swivel which is also a downfall. It’s okay for the price, but not great
It doesn’t break down very well to use in tight spots hose isn’t long enough for under the bed cleaning

Too cheaply made.  The handle breaks off with any pressure when vacuuming.  Have tried to fix twice and it just breaks off (made of plastic).  Also the head is not that maneuverable, hard to move it where you want. Does well with cat fur, but when the handle breaks, nothing works. My whole life I have only bought Hoover, I'm probably not going to do that again unless I can see it's actually sturdy and not cheap plastic

I purchased this about two months ago to replace the upright that I had been using. I needed something that was lighter to lug around without tiring me out. Since we have hardwoods and tile, this was an absolute Godsend! It's easy to carry up the stairs and the hose is super long. It picks up hair and dirt and never clogs up.
The only downside, is that the cord isn't long enough and it slowly retracts while you're using it. For now, I just put a knot in the cord. It's better than stopping to pull the cord out, and replugging time and time again.

Picked this till I could get something nicer but seems to work fine so far, for the price you're definitely getting what you pay and that's not a bad thing. I have two dogs and it picks up the dog hair just fine as long as you step down on it if you have heavy carpet since it sits pretty high off the ground. Light weight and easy to use for anyone that likes to move around fast. As long as you're not expecting anything amazing you'll be just fine going with this.

It’s great on floors and your typical carpet, but if you have a thicker more plush carpet it does not have a height adjustment and with as much suction as it has you cannot move it on the carpet. Even releasing the auction power as much as you can, it won’t move across thicker carpet.

We purchased this vacuum a few years ago. The suction through the attachments is good. As a vac for carpets and large rugs, however, it is poor and it is useless for hard floors. The "adjustment" feature is nonfunctional because the wheels that are supposed to adjust have a range of motion only 1/4" which is only affected by pressure on the wheels. The adjustment device doesn't contact the component it's intended to because the wheels have another stop which they reach first. So essentially, the wheels have only one position (since gravity and the weight of the machine push the wheels into a position you can't change) - and this position is higher than the highest carpet setting. This is not the first Windtunnel we've owned with this type of problem - but the 15 year old machine outperformed this one hands-down on carpet until its suction recently started to die (primarily due to holes developing in the tubing)). The old machine used to perform beautifully on the large indoor/outdoor rug by our back door, but this one never has because of the height. The suction is simply too far from the surface to perform properly.

The dust bin is pretty handy and has worked when we've used it. The washable filter is not handy unless you have extras so that one or two can by drying while you continue to clean.
powerful for floors great suction power chord has good length...however hose is way too short stiff and very awkward to use
Love that it's bag less, great suction capability.  Body flexibility allows you to get into tight areas.

We have a cat who sheds, sheds, sheds. The pet tool works marvelously! Light weight enough to maneuver up and down stairs in our apartment. So far, a 1000% improvement on our old vacuum, which wasn't THAT bad.

This vacuum emits dust, instead of sucking it in! I've had a few people look at it and it's a mystery as to why it's doing what it's doing.  I'm past my return window on this, so this may be going to the junk yard.
No suction.  Head really big.  Should have stayed with a light, powerful Dyson. And it’s much heavier than Dyson.  You get what you pay for!

The 1st time I pushed the brushroll on button, it went flying in the air, also popping out the spring. I tried to replace it and now it only works if I hold the button down. The suction on wood floors is great, but now I really question Hoover quality.

A bullet point that should be right up top of the description is that the "Brush cannot be stopped". How an upright Vacuum with attachments/hose does not stop the brush in the year 2020 is beyond me to surmise, but it makes the vacuum useless and harmful to your floor while using any attachment. This particular vacuum does not raise high enough on my carpeting - which is *not* a very plush pile at all. It may work well with very low pile/tile/hardwood or vinyl, but why it has 4 settings for height is beyond me as the brush doesn't raise enough.

I returned it o get a different Bissell model that does at least list that the brush can be turned off. I may have been spoiled by my last one with a lift-off container and the brush stopped when the handle was upright... I've had that for many years, but alas, it overheated this past week - poor maintenance on my part, but even then it lasted 12 years.

This vacuum is a bare floor vacuum that is marketed for carpet as well, but I would say the carpet would be like "office" carpet tiles in height only. Even then, the fact that the brush is constant - I would personally be rushing to get any attachment work done as I would be worried what the things was doing to my floor with my back turned.

I see other reviews mentioning that the vacuum just spit debris back out when using. This happened to me after one use. The hose got clogged. I had to remove screws at the base and pull clogs of debris from the hose. The suction and performance on the first use was great, but I am really not interested in having to take it apart to unclog it with any regularity, so will likely just purchase another vacuum.

Worked pretty well but just flat out broke after 2 years of gentle use. Always had a problem with animal dander (the living room would smell like Fritos whenever I vacuumed!!) But it would at least work so I put up with it. After 2 years it just seems to push things around even though it is very loud and trying to suction. I took the whole thing apart trying to trouble shoot and it looks like the rubber bands and some smaller pieces right at the vacuum opening where it suctions had broken. Im going to try to call the manufacturer but my hopes are very low.

Product arrived with the wire exposed on the cord. Amazon promptly gave me a refund. I was able to vacuum once or twice before I noticed the exposed wire (which I conceive of to be a safety issue). The vacuum worked very well which is why I gave it two starts instead of one.

I bought this vacuum because it advertised as being great for hardwood floors AND carpet (my apartment is mostly hardwood except for 1 room of carpet). However, I’ve been disappointed over and over for several reasons.

First, it doesn't work on hardwood—even if you adjust the height of the base to its lowest setting.

Second, it gets clogged CONSTANTLY. I have two long haired cats, and have hair loss myself. Plus, with cats comes cat litter. The litter, hair, and basically everything you'd expect to need vacuumed in a home with humans, clogs the hose and the base AND the filter. I just used and cleaned it out for what will be the last time, and all of the photographed hair, dust, and litter came out. Meaning, it's not sucking up much when i use it because its fully clogged.

All in all, you get what you pay for. Don't waste your money on this cheap vacuum.

I bought this vacuum to transport back and forth between my house and my grandparents. They are older and have a hard time cleaning, so I do it for them. This vacuum has been so worth the money I paid for it. It's super lightweight, feels like a lego and when you first see it you think well I'm getting what I paid for with this one. Let me tell you though, it has done an amazing job!! They have TWO 90LB GERMAN SHEPHERDS that leave hair EVERYWHERE not to mention the dust that builds up over time in their house. They previously had a crappy shark vacuum that didnt suck up anything. When I bought this and used it at their house, OMG what a difference!!! It sucked up all the hair and I swear every ounce of dust from at least the past 20 years. I had to dump the canister a million times, but that will happen when you have so much to pick up. I will also say you need to be sure to really clean the filters after a heavy duty cleaning project. I bring it home and remove the filters, wash them out really good, and then let them sit outside in the Texas heat to dry really good before using again. If you need a vacuum that sucks up pet hair really well and is super lightweight look no further. I will probably be purchasing a second one to actually leave at my grandparents house because I have found I like using it too much at my own house. It's quick and easy to just grab and use!

If you're looking for a viable alternative to a Dyson vacuum, this is it. This vacuum has great power and will satisfy 99% of your household vacuuming needs at a significant cost savings over a Dyson. It's just as maneuverable as a Dyson, has great sucking power, and is quite compact.

There are a few cons, but nothing that should stop you from buying it: the hose attachment needs to be manually hooked up to the sucking part of the vacuum - you can't just pull it out and start vacuuming your baseboards. You have to insert one end of the hose into a bypass that redirects sucking power from the main vacuum to the hose. It's mildly annoying if you're switching back and forth between the main vacuum and hose frequently, but still not a deal breaker.

The other con is this vacuum is not as easy to empty as a Dyson. There are a few more steps involved to cleaning out the filter, but again, they are only annoying and not deal breakers.

A couple of months ago, our old vacuum cleaner gave up the ghost. It went loudly with a hideous burning smell and the release of several pieces onto the living room floor one evening after dinner. Rites were said and the remnants were taken down to the closest dumpster. That meant we had to have a new vacuum as soon as possible. With a cat and two teenage boys, not to mention what Sandi and I track in, vacuuming our two bedroom apartment is a daily necessity.

So, Sandi broke out our last remaining credit card with any room at all on it and headed to Home Depot. Her main criteria were price followed ease of use. I am still trying to vacuum around here on occasion and she wanted something that I could use if I absolutely had to do it. It also needed to be light enough to heave it up and down the stairs.
She came home with the Dirt Devil MO088160 a fiery red bag-less upright that claimed to be "lightweight" and easy to use. It was $54.00 plus sales tax so it fit under the credit line cap on our Home Depot credit card. It boasted that it had a "long cord for cleaning multiple rooms" and came with two attachments. One being a crevice tool and the other being an upholstery tool. It claimed that the "lightweight design makes it easy to use and carry" and obviously being made nearly entirely out of plastic was supposed to help that. Clearly, it was a basic vacuum cleaner and that was what we needed.

After we put it together, which took about thirty minutes all together with everyone involved in the project; we fired up our latest vacuum cleaner. It worked and it still works. At this point of over sixty days of use, we have all used it a lot and have a few thoughts.

On the plus side, this vacuum cleaner seriously sucks---in a good way. It can really suck up stuff and the small light helps guide you to pick up the obvious stuff you knew was there as well as the junk you didn't see when you first walked through the room. Because it sucks so hard doing its job, if you have some rugs with fringe on them like we do, you have to be careful as it will suck the fringe right off of them. Of course, in so doing it will yank the rug into the beater bar brush and choke on it. This is much like a teenage boy trying to cram a whole hamburger into his mouth on a dare from his baby brother but much less messy. It does take a few minutes to work everything free and figure out how much damage the run has sustained. It also easily yanks in the cord off the blinds which is always helpful--especially if other family members are home to shriek at you about it while the blinds fly up in the window to slam into the top of the window frame before pulling free and crashing on the floor. It certainly has sucking power.

That sucking power does not stop one from going onto the linoleum when one leaves the shag carpeting. Our bathrooms as well as the kitchen have linoleum and it was always a pain to lower the vacuum cleaner to adjust for the different floor surface. This one does not require that manual adjustment which makes it little easier -especially on me if I have my cane in one hand so I can stand and am trying to work the vacuum cleaner in the other. If something happens, like a month ago when a plant pot committed suicide from the kitchen window sill and spayed dirt all across the kitchen floor, I could not wait seven hours for somebody else to get home and clean it up. I had to somehow do it myself and not having to adjust the vacuum cleaner helped.

But, there are some negatives. The first one is the noise this thing makes when it is on. The noise level is horrendous. It roars very loudly. I don't know how to describe it other than imagine a gasoline fired lawn mower. Now, it is not as loud as that, but it seems fairly close.

What bothers all of us more than the noise is the fact that it vents out the front. After the detritus is dropped into the bag-less cylinder (easy to remove by the way but very messy) the air shoots out the front of the machine for a radius of about a foot and a half to two feet. This means if you were watching the person vacuuming and they are coming towards you, something may fly into your eyes as has happened here. The force of air coming out of the thing just blasts you and you never know if something is going to hit you, land in your open drink, etc. the best advice is to clear the room of any other folks.

Clearing the room also helps to prevent somebody from sitting on their rear and pointing their finger wildly at different points on the floor while he or she assumes you never saw what needed to be vacumned up. Clearing the room of gawkers is helpful in nearly any home or yard situation, but I digress.

In between the pluses and the minuses are a couple of things that are negatives for us because of our own situation. They may or may not apply to your situation, but I mention them as they could be important.

First, the cord is supposed to be long and I guess at 27 feet it technically is long. However, for us with the way the plugs are laid out in the rooms and everything, 27 feet does not begin to get the job done. We have to use an extension cord to get the length to vacuum this apartment that according to the office is 1050 square feet. Otherwise, it seems all one does is unplug the vacuum cleaner and move to the next plug every couple of minutes and the job takes a lot longer.

Second, the box says it weighs less than twelve pounds and that claim is marked by an asterisk. While there is absolutely nothing in the 24 page instruction booklet (12 pages in English and 12 pages in Spanish) that explains the asterisk or anything on the box, my theory had been that the asterisk referred to the vacuum cleaner in an empty state. However, since the empty vacuum cleaner consistently weighed 18 pounds according to the home scale (which is within one pound of correct according to the scales at my wife's cardiologist) on several occasions, I am not sure how they arrive at the twelve pound claim. I do know for me (who is supposed to lift nothing more than five pounds) this thing seems extremely heavy. My oldest, who last week carried four cases of water all together at one time up the stairs for a neighbor, says the vacuum cleaner is not heavy, just cumbersome. He also loves the New York Yankees so his judgment is suspect at best.

In the end, overall, we do like the Dirt Devil MO088160 Vacuum Cleaner. Despite its drawbacks of horrendous noise and venting out the front, it does the job well. A vacuum cleaner should suck stuff up on the first pass and it does. It does that job really well which allows one to tolerate the other issues.

Kevin R. Tipple © 2011

I love Dyson vacuums, at least in terms of their ability to get floors really clean.  I had an older DC14 model for about 10 years and loved it.  But finally it lost is ability to suck (actually, the hose suction still works great!).  So I decided to go with another Dyson.  Well, I will say this DC65 is excellent at getting the floor clean!  Just amazing!  HOWEVER, I am not at all happy with the new design in terms of cleaning the hair from the brush bar.  I have long hair and I lose a lot of hair pretty regularly.  So hair always ends up wrapped around the brush bar.  I was used to cutting away all the hair from the brush bar on my old DC14, probably about every time I cleaned the filters (every 6 months).  It was pretty easy to do, just required cutting away layers of hair with scissors and pulling the hair mats out of the bristles.  Not too complicated.  This is NOT the case on the DC65.  First of all, just to access the brush bar there are 4 tiny screws in hard acrylic plastic that must be removed, which is a pain, but also something that seems like over time will cause the threads in the plastic to wear down.  Then there are two pieces to the bar which come apart and must be removed.  BUT the worst part is that there is this center part the two bar pieces connect to which is responsible for turning the bar.  It is sealed (you must have a special star screw driver to get inside of this part and the company doesn't intend for you to do so), so you would think it would be protected from hair getting sucked in.  Not the case!  I had this vacuum for a very short time, had vacuumed my house probably about 3 times and suddenly the brush bar seized up, and a terrible burning rubber smell filled the room.  Hair had been pulled inside the "sealed" center part and caused friction which melted the plastic and shredded a rubber ring.  There wasn't even a ton of hair on the brush bar! We called the Dyson twice and got the run around for over an hour.  They would not replace it because it was our fault for "not maintaining the vacuum properly." When this happened we also searched the internet to see if there was anything other had done to fix it.  We did come across other people complaining about this exact same thing, and they were unable to fix it.  Finally I sent an email expressing my disappointment in the way this matter was being handled and my new three hundred seventy dollar vacuum being ruined after just a few uses.  They did eventually replace the part for free (otherwise over a hundred dollars more!), but this is just terrible.  There was not very much hair on it at all and it ruined the brush bar! Now I am stuck disassembling my vacuum every couple times I use it to remove hair so it won't be ruined. This should not be the case!  This is a design flaw in my opinion. I never had these problems with the older DC14.  And there would be a lot of hair on that brush bar, but no damage to the vacuum!  I even choose the "pet hair" model of this DC65 (although we do not have pets inside) and it cannot handle hair!  Also, this vacuum has two filters instead of just one (maybe that's better?) which must be washed every 3 months instead of every 6 months.  And one of them is a pain to access.  And I don't like the way the vacuum goes from upright to the angled position when vacuuming.  It feels like you are breaking something to get it out of the upright position. But, I am giving it the 3 stars as defined by Amazon for an "It's Okay" rating.  It can really clean the floor and gets right up to the baseboards-- but if you have someone in the house with long hair that "sheds" be careful!
