Then after just a few uses, like others mentioned in their reviews, as I was twisting the bottom of the suction hose like you have to do to switch modes, the cheap plastic at the end of the tube just broke in two places.  This vacuum cleaner would be okay if you need a cheap vacuum at a cabin or wherever,one that is not going to have heavy use or do deep carpets.... but If you have one of these or buy one of these, be sure to treat the hose with kid gloves or it will break.
I actually liked it but the handle broke as I was using it. Another problem - it is very top heavy and tips over when you are trying to use the attachment.

Can't get over how well this vacuum operates. I've had a Shark and a Dyson both broke. This one so far is working beautifully. Love the cord zipping away. I've always hated wrap the cord up when done. Keeping my fingers crossed that this one will last a while. All indications it will.
very noisy...suction is alright because each time i empty the canister is is full and the filter is easy to clean.
I purchased this in November and now one not working. It was good to start with, but it hasn't last a full 7 months.
Affordable price for a great vacuum.  So far very satisfied with product.  Pet hair attachment has been worked great. Would definitely buy it again.

I bought this one because I have very thick carpet, and my old Vac didn’t work well. This new one advertises height adjustment, but if there was any adjustment at all, I couldn't see it!  The Vac wouldn’t even move on my carpet, so thinking it was defective, I ordered a replacement... nope! That one wouldn’t move either. Bottom line: fine for bare floors or low carpet, nothing else!

Bought this to replace an aging/dying Eureka Boss. Needless to say, I was very impressed with the sucking power of this vacuum cleaner. I went through the whole house, and had to take apart the cleaner twice as it was pulling in so much dust, that it was getting caked in it !. The bagless feature makes emptying it real easy. My old one had the filter inside the collection bag, which made emptying the bag a nightmare - with dust flying all around. But here, since the filter is separate, emptying the container is as simple as taking it out and turning it over. And since it is plastic, cleaning it is real easy as well.

One note though - When the roller brush is on (for carpets) it tends to pull the vacuum cleaner away from you - some might find it difficult to manage since the cleaner by itself is a bit on the heavier side.

Overall, a good value for the money that really works.

I had an older shark for years and loved it but it got messed up when we started using it to clean up demo work. We bought an expensive dyson that didn’t even last a year so we agreed on another shark vacuum. While this is a great vacuum the suction is SO intense. I have to use 2 hands my whole body to vacuum any room with carpet. My husband has stated he has a hard time moving it b

After moving into our new house, I discovered that our Dyson wouldn't work on our new plush Mohawk (Smartstrand) carpet upstairs, so I found this machine at the local stores (needed something quick!). I can at least push it through the carpet with it on the highest setting. It picks up alot of dirt, as seen in the canister. But it's a full-body experience pushing it through my thick/plush carpet.

As far as the rest of the vacuum features, I really dislike having three sections to clean out (two are simple, but still messy). I'm about to clean the filter for the first time...hate doing that in any bagless! This appears to be especially messy..we shall see.

I did learn, while cleaning my stairs with the "Turbo Brush" attachment, that it's USELESS! Sure, when you hook it up to the hose, it spins and looks great. Put it on the carpet and it stops because the airflow has stopped. So therefore no suction either. The other tool barely has much suction to it either, but I at least could somewhat clean my stairs.
The hose only stretched to half-way on the stairs. Had to move the vacuum to the other end to get the rest of the stairs.

All in all, it gets the job done, barely. But I wouldn't buy another one like it. I am looking at another Bissel for my upstairs carpets- because it would have 2" higher on the height (7" vs 5" on this Rewind model), which might make it easier to vacuum my newer carpets.

Didn't last six months. Motor fried/died. Don't waste your money on ths vacuum like I did.
I wish I would of read some reviews first before buying it. Other people have had the same complaint as I do.
Within 48 hours the roller stopped rolling and several hours later started working again. Hoping it was just a fluke

I purchased this vacuum based off of all the good reviews. I think if you live alone in a very small home or apartment it would be perfect. It does have very good suction. However, if you are like me and you have a house full of pets(4 large dogs), kids, a busy husband and 2 acres of property that ends up inside your house you will be forever frustrated with this vacuum. The filter gets clogged up so fast and it's a pain in the butt to clean it out every 5 minutes. I would recommend spending a little more money and get a shark vacuum.

I bought this vacuum because I have a Bissell already that was, overall, a good vacuum. Its plastic handle broke and I cannot find a replacement part for it (too old I guess). My old vacuum has the beater bar so I keep the old vacuum that now has a short handle specifically for area rugs.

As my previous Bissell, the power and suction is good. It is specifically for hardwood floors so no beater bar and I like that. The lobster claw shape, surprisingly, is helpful in getting into some areas like corners and especially around a stove. The assembly could not be easier. It comes in 3 parts and they click together. That's it! The vacuum is especially light, which I really appreciate. The length of the cord was OK. For its solid-surface function it performs well so far. I just vacuumed the entire house with it. The cleaning of this looks to be very similar to my last Bissell, so that looks to be easy. Empty the cup, twist out the piece above the cup, and wash and put back the foam filter. I like the Bissell brand, and hoover, because the motor is powerful and lasts. The price I paid is reasonable.

However, this vacuum will not go totally horizontal to get under a bed. The description implied that, but it isn't possible. It lays down quite a ways but won't clean horizontal - the claw will start to raise up. Because of that I would really like an attachment to get under a bed! There are no attachments with this vacuum. I tried vacuuming an area rug, and it did get some debris but really you need a vacuum with a beater brush for a rug, so this is not adequate for that purpose.

So overall, I like the vacuum for daily use to keep down the cat hair because I have no wall to wall carpeting. But because I cannot clean under a bed with it, and there is no attachment for that, I rated it with 3 stars overall. I would not buy it again if I had it to do over, simply for that reason. But I did not return it either. All other aspects of the vacuum are positive. So my message to Bissell is that they make good vacuums, and this one would be a GREAT vacuum if they could resolve the under-bed issue. I would also add that even the high end models and brands seldom last for more than 5 years - tops. So because of that I do not buy high end vacuums any longer. I learned my lesson about that on an expensive Dyson that died after just a few months.

After using this product for a couple of days, I will return.  While it did seem to have lots of power as described, when trying to use the hose attachment it was blowing debris from the detached area into the room?!  Also, the hose itself is also too short and after attempting to reach an area at full extension, the vacuum would fall on me.  Not very safe and very disappointed.  I will return to my Eureka Smart Vac!

Although, on first unboxing and assembling, this vacuum seems a bit small and more like a stick vac but once put into use, it is indeed very impressive! Lots of suction power (be sure to note the 2 step on button and choose the right option for carpet or hard floors), and the maneuverability is excellent! Being smaller and lightweight allows you to get in places you couldn’t possibly reach with a standard sized vacuum. The lift off capability is very handy for stairs and reaching high places with the flexible hose and wand. This is the perfect vacuum for smaller, weaker or older folks and I couldn’t be happier.

This is very loud. I was willing to accept that, but seriously--you need ear protection.  I've had it less than a year and the brush roll broke in half. I cannot find the replacement for this part. I can find every other Bissell brush roll replacement part for other models but not 2252.  It's probably because the vacuum is so cheap they figured that you'd just buy another one. I'm bummed that I sold my older Shark because that lasted years and it was still going. I just wanted one specifically for pet hair.  This suction was good until the part broke and now it spits everything back onto the floor.

I do like how easy it makes cleaning the floor. BUT 4 out of the 5 times I've used it the dirty water reservoir has spilled all over my clean floor...which is madding. I think the lock on it is broken because when I take it out the lid pops off and it takes me longer to clean up the mess than it did to do the floors.

Just got this vacuum. For the price, so far I am ver satisfied. Easy, intuitive assebly - strong suction- no quirks or bugs yet. I vaccumed the carpet in my room and it worked perfectly. I also used the vacuum outside on a tile patio and it did work - however not as well as it did on the carpet. It is a large vacuum, I ranked the maneuverability as 3 stars. Overall I gave this a 4 star review. Please remember : I just purchased this vacuum. I have not tested the durability or longevity. Hope this helps!

I used to have this vacuum when i was a kid for like 10 years or so. Bought it again, cause house is in need of vacuuming. The cleaning and suction power remains as I remember. Some will complain about noise, but I had one before and I'm okay with sound from vacuums. One thing is, I can agree with others on, is the vaccum does seem a bit cheaper, like the plastic and build of it. The vacuum remains a cleaning beast, but the material or design used to build it now seems cheap. I'd say good vacuum for the price, power, and reliability.  Just make sure to maintain it. Bags and replacement parts are cheap people. Also bag vacuums will always clean better than these new cheaper vacuums that are bagless. I’m very impressed with this cordless vacuum. I’ve been searching for something cordless to grab for quick cleanups. It has a large dust bin. The battery last

In the past I have purchased many expensive vacuums that promised to pick up pet hair. About 6 years ago I purchased this Shark and it sucked up the cat hair on my old wall to wall carpets so well that they looked new again.  When the roller brush on my old trusty Shark stopped working after giving me such good service, I looked for another. Fortunately they still make it although it was more than $60 more expensive. Still I thought that I wanted a known rather than taking a chance on something else.  I am happy to report that the new one works just as well as the old one did and sucks up that pet hair quickly and easily.
It seems to do everything it is supposed to do and it does it well.With the price and free shipping right to my door i am completely satisfied.
Great vacuum for floors , only issue I have is, it doesn’t reach under furniture very well. But, I do like the cleaning power it has.

For the past 10 years my go-to vacuum has been a Dyson DC28 Animal. It’s been the best vacuum I’ve ever owned. Technically it’s not as powerful as a previous Hoover Wind Tunnel, but unlike all the Hoover and Bissels I’ve owed, it’s lasted longer than the warranty. This Samsung costs less than pretty much any Dyson you can buy, so the question is how does it compare?

I did some objective testing on hardwood and carpet by spreading out some rice and some sandbox sand. I weighed out two equal amounts of both, spread them around, vacuumed, and then emptied and weighed the results. The difference between them was minor and in repeat tests the winner varied. That told me that “how” I vacuumed was probably a bigger variable than raw suction.

For usability I found that the old Dyson was heavier and harder to maneuver. This was an advantage in one case: when you are using the tools on the Samsung and stretch out the hose it’s easy to knock it over. The Dyson can be pulled over but it’s much harder. The lift-off feature was nice, though with the Dyson’s long hose I can achieve the same effect.

The Dyson feels and looks sturdier. The Samsung is lighter, but the plastic seems more fragile. I also found the Dyson much easier to empty, though both are a pain to clean out if it gets too full of dirt and dust. I also managed to jam up the Samsung roller with hair once. It was easy to clear, but it’s something I have to do to the Dyson once a year. Having it happen after a week of use with the Samsung was not inspiring.

In the end the Samsung is a much better value. For easily ½ the price you get pretty much all the performance (granted the test was against a 10 year old Dyson and from what I’ve read the newer Dysons are more powerful than mine). Time will tell, but I don’t expect to get the same reliability. Ultimately I think that’s what you are buying with Dyson. If money is tight this Samsung is the smart buy. If your budget can handle it I’d certainly consider the Dyson and whether the brand reliability is worth the increased price.

I give it five stars due to I have all of one hundred fifty feet of carpet and for the price no better vacuum could be found, it was easy to assemble and get going, shipping was quicker than expected, overall a good experience.
This is a good product for hardwood floors and pet hair. Great turning radius. I only gave one star because the clamp that keeps the hose in place broke immediately.

I have found that you need to seperate the canister from the wand to use this vacuum comfortably
I checked with my purple Dyson ball vacuum to see how good this vacuum was doing and the Dyson cleaned a little better at least on carpets
I like that this shark polishes wood floors
I do like carrying the canister and vacuuming (much easier) than the dyson but the dyson is easier to move around than this shark if you don't want to seperate
This Shark is way too hard to use if you don't seperate and carry the canister
The item came broken. Very disappointing— so many good reviews and mine comes with a handle that doesn’t stay attached to the base. Now I have to go out of my way to return it to UPS.

We have two long-haired cats, one medium and one short haired dog. We got this vacuum specifically because it is supposed to be for pet hair. Unfortunately the pet hair adapter is completely useless. The "spinning" part of the attachment that is supposed to be suction operated doesn't even spin making it no more useful than the other extension and at least if it had brushes like other vacuums it would help get up dirt on upholstery.

This was well worth the money and works great for car hair on the couch and beds. Works great on hardwoods and the attachments are great too!

Just what I needed. Haven't gotten the full size vacuum out since I got this. Cleaning and emptying out dirt cup often helps a lot. I use a seam ripper to clean the brush out weekly since we all have long hair and an all white American Eskimo dog. Life just got a little easier!

I bought this based on many reviews and as an attempt to try something different than shark which I have used for a long time. To say I am disappointed would be an understatement. It appears to be cheap even though it's a $250 vacuum it is cumbersome and not easily maneuvered. The LED headlights were one of the best features of this as well as the crevice tool with the LED light however all of the other negatives have me returning the item after one use due to a total disappointment.

Kind of disappointing in that the suction on wood floors is not what we were hoping. It is light, easy to use and easy to charge. But, ultimately, if what you are looking for is a good suction, this one is about a B-
It was a direct replacement part. Which is good because the shampooer belongs to my wife and I broke the original one.
Had it put together and vacuuming in less than 2 minutes. Great suction! Would've gave it 5 stars, but the carpet height adjustment is worthless.

I like the product to begin with. When it worked. After four and a half months the bristles stopped rotating. Amazon was the listed seller so I contacted them since it's clearly defective. They've told me contact the manufacturer. Generally you can take these things back to the seller. Or at least that's how I used to be! This is going to be fun trying to deal with the manufacturer who I'm sure is going to tell me to contact the seller! this is my second  Eureka Airspeed  to purchase I had to purchase a new one when the other ones canister cracked.......I thought this one was the same model as my first Airspeed which I Loved Loved Loved to my disappointment it isn't and the performance is not near as good as either.....The filters are expensive but washable which is a nice feature but have to be replaced after a few washings which when owning my first model I did not mind because  the job it did was awesome....I tested my first Airspeed when I first received it to see how well it picked up I groomed my doodle on the carpet and let the hairs fall to the floor she is white and silver and the carpet is light in color I shaved several long strips which of course as hair will do went everywhere I then ran the vac over the area 3-4  times  then wet down a dark rag which I ran over the just vacuumed spot and WOW no hairs I was super super happy with that vac. but not this one why do you have to change something that is already near perfect with something that does not even begin to compare.....If it works and people love it leave it alone don't change it!

I purchased this vacuum approximately 2 years ago.  It worked well for about the 1st year, but we started to have small problems shortly after that.  Then last week, our vacuum completely stopped working and it will no longer turn on.  The vacuum has a 3 year parts and labor warranty so we called the customer service number to find an authorized repair place.  I ended up calling customer service 3 times for locations and every location I called said that they do not honor the warranties because Eureka does not reimburse enough for it to be worth their time.  I finally gave up when the gave me a warranty center 2 hours from my city.  You would be much better off paying more for a vacuum that is from a company that follows through with their warranties.
Loved this when I first received it. Today the stair tool stopped spinning. Not sure why vacuum companies won't provide quality tools. I've had it about 6 weeks.

This is a bulkier machine than I've ever purchased but works great. I decided on this one because we have multiple pets and our older on just couldn't do the job of picking up all the pet hair.  This one picks up every the heavier particles so suction gets a five star.  But because it's bigger doesn't work good for getting under beds and furniture.  I still make it work by using the extensions.  The one negative is the placement of the extension cord. It always ends up under the vacuum and I'm always having to hold it up as I vacuum. Other than I'm happy with my purchase and do recommend it.

this thing makes super weird noises, like so weird that we have questioned if we got one that has a problem. works ok - not great, but ok. I'd say "adequate" is a good descriptor. very difficult and messy to clean. In fact, this is the biggest knock against it, and that was the dealbreaker for us. we intended to send it back but our kids destroyed the box so now we are the not-so-proud forever-owners of this strange-sounding adequate vacuum that leaves my floors messier when I empty the bin than whatever was gained from vacuuming. oh well :/

stopped working after a month. Just pushes dirt around. And hose has exactly ZERO pick up. I spent more money on a new filter, thinking that might be the problem. But no such luck. And now it's too late to send back to amazon. Waste of money.
Had to take it in for repairs within 3 months of purchase.  Luckily it has a 3 year warranty.  Aside from concerns about durability, it does suck- I mean it is effective at what it is supposed to do.

This vaccum is light and not very loud, but it has excellent sucking power.  It cleans so much better than anything I have had before.  It's not super pretty (gray and safety orange) but it for sure does its job like a boss!  The only thing I am not crazy about is that it does not have a retractable cord so you have to manually roll up the cord each time after using it, but for all the positives, I can deal with the extra 20 seconds it takes to wrap up the cord.

My husband and I thought this would at least last us a year or so with the little use it would get i.e. a rug and carpeted room. However, the when I used it on a thicker rug on the highest setting the belt just broke. The issue with this is that you will not get a refund or even another free belt in either the Bissells limited warranty or from Amazon.

Also to use the vacuum hose is difficult since it is rather short and you're having to lug this big upright vacuum around nearly every foot you move.

The fact that you can wash the filter is a good point.

If we could invest a lot more money into something that is a little more durable I believe we would've. At this rate we will most likely either have to purchase 10 belts a year or get a different, better quality vacuum.

You get what you pay for!
Bought recently, with 3 pets and 3 kids I really needed to vacuum this evening. It just shut off and won't turn back on. VERY FRUSTRATING!!!
Bought end of March and by mid June it has stopped working. Don't waste your money on this. It may seem like a good deal because it's affordable but always remember...you get what you pay for.
This vacuum is a pain in the butt. The attachments don't stay on good, the wand won't stay in as you vacuum.
the unit worked for only two cleaning of our home, lost all suction. and now I need to return it to hoover. not happy at all, it was rated as a best buy by consumer reports. not a chance.
This vacuum is great! Love the fact there's no paper filters, and the air/sponge filters are easy to clean. After 3 months and daily use, I am extremely pleased with this product.

Just had carpets replaced after 10 years in the house.  Very little dirt on the floor beneath.  Carpet installer commented that I must have a very good vacuum cleaner.  Love that I can see when the bag is getting full and it is easy to snap it off and clean it.  Good suction and the auto cord winder is my favorite part!!

Not a fantastic product. Maybe if it was being used to clean already perfectly clean floors it would work well, but it isn't designed to suck up any dirt or hair. Even the littlest amount of hair can damage it. With 3 dogs around, nearly impossible. Not convenient to pre clean, before I clean

Purchased 03/2019- model# AZ1002

Floor nozzle head wheels wore out causing the machine sit lower against the floor. Maybe not a big deal if you have carpet, but if you have tile the grout is rough enough to wear the substandard wheels out. If you have tile and hardwood I would suspect the wood would get scratched due to the unit now sitting lower and certain areas of the plastic floor nozzle now skimming the surface, roughing up the plastic.

1/2021 (less than 3 years after purchase and with the 5 ur limited warranty) the front brush roll belt broke.

Diagnosed the issues, found the floor nozzle wearing strange due to the wheels being worn slap out, so decided to call shark c/s.

Agent did a video chat to view the pieces and I was told—— get this!!!- the floor nozzle is not a warranty replaceable or repairable item. Ok, well my floor nozzle is fine, it’s just the wheels and belt.

To which I’m told those items can’t be replaced, regardless, the floor nozzle is considered a wearable item and not covered under warranty.

So don’t be fooled by the warranty saying:

“ Normal wear and tear of wearable parts (such as foam filters, HEPA filters, pads, etc.), which require regular maintenance and/or replacement to ensure the proper functioning of your unit, are not covered by this warranty.”

Who would have thought that the floor nozzle is an item that requires regular maintenance and replacement.

For some unknown reason I didn’t use Amex to purchase so now I’ve got no recourse but to buy the items shark won’t sell and fix the unit myself.

All this time wasted and my calculation into what my time is worth, I should have just bought the parts and been done with it.

Never will I ever buy another shark/ninja product. Pretty crappy warranty tactics- but hey, I fell for a listing that items not covered that was open ended.

Pretty much the only thing covered is the motor.

It does the same job as the high priced machines.  You are not going to see any difference.  The only drawback and why I could only give it 4 stars is that the cord is too short.  So if you don't to want constantly plug and unplug as you move about you gotta use and a decent extention cord that costs about 12 bucks.

Piece of garbage. I kept it for about 7 months and it was trouble from the start. Good product, does completely well its job. after almost 6 month I did not need to change any filter yet.

I was slightly disappointed in the perfirmsnce, I had higher expectations as far as the scrubbing power. But the floors feel very clean, but if you want something to scrub you will have to scrub them yourself.

Purchased this and it broke the first time that I used it.  First the clean water tank fell off as I was using it (It was secured when I started) and the handle shattered. For the price of this vacuum I’m very disappointed. It’s very heavy and clunky. I have a Great Dane so therefore I have lots of dog hair and it doesn’t work as well as I had hoped.

This is a wonderful vacuum!  It glides under the coach and between furniture and has a powerful suction.  Unfortunately, I had to send it back and get the DC25. The DC40 did a great job on the hardwoods and would do a good job on carpets as well, but with all of our pets we needed a little more power. I was thrilled with the reconditioned vacuums.  They were both just like new!  I love Dysons!

Cheap vacuum, so don't expect great things.  The Amazon pics are fake  They Photoshopped a pic of a woman using the wand where it looks much longer than it actually is.  I'm 6'2" and I have to get down on my hands and knees to use the hose attachment on floors. The vacuum itself works very nicely and I am sure we will enjoy the use of this unit once we can resolve this issue.

UPDATE: We communicated via the phone on the Tuesday after a Saturday delivery. Told the story and we were instructed to box up the entire unit and return it by UPS.

We only needed a battery!!

UPDATE TO THE UPDATE
Wednesday A.M.: writing this review and the doorbell rings. FedEx with a new Hoover!!!! Seriously -- overnight.....

Immediately, I open the boxes (yes, boxes) to get to the area where the batteries are stored. Check the first one for a charge: Yes!
Check out the charge on the second: Yes!
I then placed a battery on the charger, which worked, and a battery on the unit and gave it test drive. SUCCESS!!!! On to 5-stars.

Needs carry handle for transport up and down stairs. The silver finish is easily rubbed off or damaged with normal use. Otherwise no complaints. Includes switch for power carpet beater bar which some vacuums don’t have.  Important for LVP or wood floors.  Hose could be longer but it’s adequate.

I was somewhat disappointed. I had hoped it would clean my kitchen floor better than I could with a sponge mop with scrubber and spray cleaner. It comes out about the same. The big advantage of the Hoover is that it sucks up the water eliminating the constant need to rinse and wring out the sponge mop. My finger  gets tired though from squeezing the cleaning solution release  trigger . Also I am not sure what the Boost lever does. I don't notice any significant change in cleaning. Since I own the machine I will continue to use it in place of a mop. In time I expect it will get easier to use.

This machine was working fine.  It wasn't great, but it did do the job to get excess water off my hardwood floors.  The suction could have been better, but it did work.  I have dogs and cats and like to get a deep clean of the floor.  Maps just push dirty water around.  This machine worked in the sense that every time I used it on a weekly basis the water in the return was almost black.  I had been using for about a year when one day I turned the unit on.  Thirty seconds later it just stopped.  I called customer service and because I did not have the original receipt they told me they could not issue a warranty repair.  However, they offered me a 50% discount on a new unit.  I thought this was a fair deal and great customer service, until I looked on their website and saw that all units were already discounted the same amount.  I mentioned that to the customer service rep and he said, "Right.  I discounted off the retail price."  Misleading.  Telling me you are giving me a discount when the item is already discounted is not a discount.  Time to find another more reliable brand with more transparent customer service.

It's a vacuum, it does what it's suppose to do.

It's very difficult to get it out of "lock" position. I honestly don't know why it's so difficult. When you push the peddle to release the body of the vacuum (it's not standing upright) it doesn't even do anything, you really have to yank it off.

I just put mine together and turned it in and the roller is not working.  For $200 this should not be an issue.  And no, I'm not going to try to troubleshoot or anything because I SHOULDN'T HAVE TO WITH A NEW PRODUCT.  Don't waste your time.  Also, I will never purchase a Hoover brand again.  This was the first and last time.

I bought a second after using one with my daughters recommendation. Large house and a lot of stairs. They are good at first but they self destruct with hair getting into the moving parts and binding up the motor. Roller Brush binds up and breaks with human hair or fibers and kill the vacuum. Do not Buy these until the design changes for the better.

This vacuum is light weight and powerful. We have 4 dogs so we vacuum daily. I have had it for a month and had no issues. It works great and is easy to clean. My only gripe is that the attachments fall off of the vacuum. Easy enough fix I just take them off before I use it.

We liked this vacuum and it worked well, but the handle snapped off after owning for 18 months. We used it probably 5 times a week to vacuum a 10x12 rug, just straight lines, no vacuuming around furniture or anything. My daughter also had one purchased a few months prior to our purchase.  Her handle broke about 9 months after she bought it, but I assumed that was from misuse as they were a bit rougher with their vacuum.  It snapped while vacuuming at a straight angle. So it works well, but there must be some kind of defect with the material in the handle.

I gave this vacuum four stars originally because it has suction like I have never seen, and it has all of the features I wanted... The longer cord, brush roll shut-off, and the long hose and extension wand.  It has a very high reach in order to get dust off ceiling corners, light fixtures, etc.  However, I was very disappointed when it arrived!  It was not packed very securely. There was only a cardboard bracing around the main part and the other parts were only partially wrapped in plastic. I recently purchased a different Hoover model from Target which I returned due to a model defect, and when it arrived it looked very new and modern and was packed with heavy styrofoam all around it and all wrapped in plastic.  I was so pleased!  Then, I discovered that the cord was getting extremely heated, so I looked it up on the Hoover site and found multiple reviews about the machine overheating.  So, I returned it and ordered this one from Amazon.com. It was the model I originally wanted, but I was leery about ordering a vacuum online.  I worried about problems and having to return online.  I didn't listen to that still small voice and lo and behold I was very disappointed... I am concerned that it might have received abuse in the shipping and the color is not as pictured in the photos...  it is a bright turquoise and looks like something out of the 50s!  Ugh!  Turquoise is the one color I do not like at all...  The color in the photo appears to be a nice blue.  So, I don't know if I received an old refurbished one by mistake or if the information was misrepresented.  Amazon.com did give me a rebate to compensate, but I am still disgusted.  It seems rather cheaply made, especially in comparison to the one I purchased from Target.  However, the Target one (can't remember the model #) didn't have the high reach and longer hose and cord. Also, on the bright side, as I said, it has some good features and great suction.  It just depends on what your priorities are, so I will keep this for the features I like and hope it holds up.  If there is a change I will do an update later.  UPDATE:  I lowered the amount of stars I originally gave to this vacuum because I found that it does not work well at all on bare floors!  My laundry room has some type of linoleum on the floor and when I used the bare floor setting, the suction was so extreme that it not only did not move, but it ripped the top layer of the linoleum right off in spots!  I would like to sue Hoover as I will be responsible for the damage to the floor!  What is wrong with Hoover now?  They used to be tops in vacuums.  Now they have so many different models all with major flaws... why not make a few and perfect them!  Check out their site at hoover.com and you will see the low ratings their vacuums have.

I wanted to like this, but it just doesn't make me happy.  We have 2 dogs who shed, and it often leaves clumps on the floor instead of picking it up.  It's also hard to clean out.  The dirt and hair get trapped at the top and have to be dug out.  I wish I could just talk to dogs into not shedding.

I really want to like this...and I do when it works.  The vacuum itself, the canister works great. However the frame is cheap plastic.  I bought this 1 Jan 2018.  Had a warranty replacement because the brushes stopped turning no matter what in Sep 2018.  I have tile floors, 3 area rugs, about 2100 sq feet, one cat and a 1x a week housekeeper who is the primary user of the vacuum, to give you an idea on workload.  They did send me a complete replacement unit, so I kept the old canister, ditched the old frame and it is nice that I could have two canisters, one charging and one in use.  Now, Oct 2019, the wheel on the replacement frame snapped off.  Nothing exciting in the use (e.g. only 12 months of use on this frame).  Unfortunately the lower half of the frame is the only piece you can't buy a standalone replacement of.  However we'll see if B&D considers this an under-warranty replacement.  If they do...great company to keep working with me, but cheap frame on this item.  As much as I like cordless too, I might consider a corded one.  The battery life is insufficient for my whole house (so the spare canister is awesome and necessary).
Great product but WAY too heavy. Also cord is clunky and in the way at the base of the machine. Keeps coming loose from a stay on the side and tangling around my feet.

Worked good with minimal issues every now and then up to the 6 month return/warranty mark. Right after and they won't do anything about it ir help me see whats wrong and what needs to be replaced. Horrible customer service from the seller and Amazon. Complete bs

I didn’t realize how crappy my old vacuum was until I got this bissell. Seeing everything it’s actually pulled up is gross and satisfying. Had it about a week now and have vacuumed everyday because it is so satisfying

DO NOT BUY.  5 days after the 30 day return ran out my vacuum started letting out black smoke & was hotter than an oven. You'll see other reviews similar. Done with Bissell. I have 3 children. And my oldest will sometimes vacuum. If he had been vacuum he might not have know to shut it off quickly (considering its not everyday a brand new vacuum tries to destroy itself.) And someone could've been hurt. Bissell obviously has lost a customer. Their vacuums have been getting cheaper & crappier the last few. This was the last vacuum I'll buy from them.

Works great, I vacuumed with old sweeper and then the New Sharp. WOW, what a difference. and i thought the old was doing a good job.
And really a low noise level and less AMP draw 12 to do same job. Select the professional model for pet hair pickup.
Please read instructions for assembly and use prior to using. Really helps.Highly recommend to others.

I ordered this vacuum and paid for the next day delivery. I unpacked the vacuum the next day when it arrived, put it together and turned it on. Within seconds the beater bar stopped moving and smoke came out of the belt window. I turned the vacuum over and opened the beater bar compartment and found that the belt was burnt in half. I called Hoover customer service and they said a replacement belt was on the way. Still have not received it so the vacuum is worthless at the moment. All of my previous vacuums came with extra drive belts. No spares with this one.

The vacuum was a Consumer Reports best buy but I cannot prove that assessment yet.

This vacuum is much better than any other vacuum my family has bought in the past. Vacuums are so prone to falling apart, and many of them don't even do a good job. But Shark has a solid reputation of making products that last and actually do their job. An excellent buy!
We use it on laminate, rug and carpet. Got it for my son in college who uses it to clean apartment. Easy to use
The suction on this vacuum is not that great, will not be purchasing from this line of products again.

Compact, lightweight, and multi-use with all of the different nozzles. I absolutely LOVE this vacuum and am so pleased with my purchase. It is effective, easy to use, and cleaning it is simple. It changes suction power automatically based on if you're using it on carpet or hardwood, but you can also control the settings manually. I wouldn't use it as my only vacuum for a large house because it is pretty compact, but for smaller living spaces this is the best deal you will find. Vacuuming without having to mess with a long, tangled cord is life-changing.

Easy to use, clean and light for when you need to carry it up several floors (live in a 3 story townhouse). Cleans carpet and sucks up dirt very well. Wish the hose was a little longer though, that's my only complaint. It's very compact though and you can't beat the price.
This vacuum is so light weight that is soon as you pull the hose just a little bit the The vacuum cleaner falls over.Even though it’s light weight I would not recommend not worth the money

I had this vacuum when it first came out. Ex got it with the divorce. I am so glad to have found it at an affordable price. Def. Worth the buy.

I have 3 German shepards and have been using a basic vacuum until I received this one. Had to dump it after only vacuuming a small section of my carpet due to all the hair!

This vacuum is a lifesaver and I 100% recommend it for anyone with pets and/or allergies
